com.netflix.fenzo

Interface AutoScaleRule


  • public interface AutoScaleRule
    A rule that defines when to scale the number of hosts of a certain type. You define one rule for each unique value of the host attribute that you have designated to differentiate autoscale groups (see the withAutoScaleByAttributeName() task scheduler builder method).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getCoolDownSecs()
      Returns the amount of time to wait from the beginning of a scale up or scale down operation before initiating another autoscale operation (a.k.a the "cool down" time).
      int getMaxIdleHostsToKeep()
      Returns the maximum number of hosts, in the autoscale group this rule applies to, that Fenzo is to keep in idle readiness.
      int getMinIdleHostsToKeep()
      Returns the minimum number of hosts, in the autoscale group this rule applies to, that Fenzo is to keep in idle readiness.
      java.lang.String getRuleName()
      Returns the value, for the group of hosts that this rule applies to, of the host attribute that you have designated to differentiate autoscale groups.
      boolean idleMachineTooSmall(VirtualMachineLease lease)
      Determines whether a host has too few resources to be considered an idle but potentially useful host.

    • Method Detail

      • getRuleName

        java.lang.String getRuleName()
        Returns the value, for the group of hosts that this rule applies to, of the host attribute that you have designated to differentiate autoscale groups. This acts as the name of the autoscaling group.
        Returns:
        the value of the designated host attribute, which is the name of the autoscaling group this rule applies to

      • getMinIdleHostsToKeep

        int getMinIdleHostsToKeep()
        Returns the minimum number of hosts, in the autoscale group this rule applies to, that Fenzo is to keep in idle readiness. Keeping idle hosts in a standby state like this allows Fenzo to rapidly launch new jobs without waiting for new instances to spin up.
        Returns:
        the minimum number of idle hosts to maintain in this autoscale group

      • getMaxIdleHostsToKeep

        int getMaxIdleHostsToKeep()
        Returns the maximum number of hosts, in the autoscale group this rule applies to, that Fenzo is to keep in idle readiness. Keeping idle hosts in a standby state like this allows Fenzo to rapidly launch new jobs without waiting for new instances to spin up.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of idle hosts to maintain in this autoscale group

      • getCoolDownSecs

        long getCoolDownSecs()
        Returns the amount of time to wait from the beginning of a scale up or scale down operation before initiating another autoscale operation (a.k.a the "cool down" time). Suppress autoscale actions for this many seconds after a previous autoscale action.
        Returns:
        the cool down time, in seconds

      • idleMachineTooSmall

        boolean idleMachineTooSmall(VirtualMachineLease lease)
        Determines whether a host has too few resources to be considered an idle but potentially useful host. This is used to filter out hosts with too few resources before considering them to be excess resources. If they are not filtered out, they could prevent a much-needed scale up action.
        Parameters:
        lease - the lease object that representes the host
        Returns:
        true if the idle machine has too few resources to count as idle, false otherwise
